title: How does an atom-smashing particle accelerator work? - Don Lincoln

multiple-choice.question: What is the approximate circumference of the Large Hadron Collider (LHC)?

options.label: B
options.text: To collide atomic nuclei together at extremely high energy

options.label: D
options.text: To study the properties of electrons

multiple-choice.question: What is the temperature of the beam-containing region of the LHC?

options.label: A
options.text: Accelerating an electron to a speed that would take 1 minute to get a lead of 10 feet over a photon

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

How do subatomic particle accelerators work?

options.label: C

options.label: B
options.text: To make particles move in a circular path

options.label: A
options.text: To study the properties of electrons

title: What is Zeno’s Dichotomy Paradox? - Colm Kelleher

multiple-choice.question: Who is the ancient Greek philosopher famous for inventing paradoxes, including the dichotomy paradox?

options.label: B
options.text: The paradox of cutting in two

multiple-choice.question: According to the dichotomy paradox, what is required to travel from one location to another?
What is the flaw in Zeno's logic, according to the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: He assumes that motion is impossible

options.label: B
options.text: He assumes that time is infinite

options.label: C
options.text: He assumes that infinitely many finite-sized terms cannot add up to a finite answer

options.label: D
options.text: He assumes that the journey is too long

options.label: C
options.text: Both can be added up to a finite answer

multiple-choice.question: What happens to the area of the square as it is sliced into smaller and smaller pieces?

How is the paradox resolved, according to the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: By assuming that motion is impossible

options.label: B
options.text: By assuming that time is infinite

options.label: C
options.text: By showing that infinitely many finite-sized terms can add up to a finite answer

options.label: D
options.text: By assuming that the journey is too long
